member.name: T:Google.ApplicationContext

member.remarks: It creates a if no logger was registered previously

member.summary: Registers a logger with this application context.
member.exception: Thrown if a logger was already registered.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Http.BackOffHandler
member.summary: A thread-safe back-off handler which handles an abnormal HTTP response or an exception with .

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Http.BackOffHandler.Initializer
member.summary: An initializer class to initialize a back-off handler.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Http.BackOffHandler.Initializer.BackOff
member.summary: Gets the back-off policy used by this back-off handler.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Http.BackOffHandler.Initializer.MaxTimeSpan
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum time span to wait. If the back-off instance returns a greater time span than this value, this handler returns false to both HandleExceptionAsync and HandleResponseAsync. Default value is 16 seconds per a retry request.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Http.BackOffHandler.Initializer.HandleUnsuccessfulResponseFunc
member.summary: Gets or sets a delegate function which indicates whether this back-off handler should handle an abnormal HTTP response. The default is .

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Http.BackOffHandler.Initializer.HandleExceptionFunc
member.summary: Gets or sets a delegate function which indicates whether this back-off handler should handle an exception. The default is .

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Http.BackOffHandler.Initializer.DefaultHandleUnsuccessfulResponseFunc
member.summary: Default function which handles server errors (503).

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Http.BackOffHandler.Initializer.DefaultHandleExceptionFunc
member.summary: Default function which handles exception which aren't or . Those exceptions represent a task or an operation which was canceled and shouldn't be retried.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Http.BackOffHandler.Initializer.#ctor(Google.Apis.Util.IBackOff)
member.summary: Constructs a new initializer by the given back-off.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Http.BackOffHandler.BackOff
member.summary: Gets the back-off policy used by this back-off handler.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Http.BackOffHandler.MaxTimeSpan
member.summary: Gets the maximum time span to wait. If the back-off instance returns a greater time span, the handle method returns false. Default value is 16 seconds per a retry request.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Http.BackOffHandler.HandleUnsuccessfulResponseFunc
member.summary: Gets a delegate function which indicates whether this back-off handler should handle an abnormal HTTP response. The default is .

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Http.BackOffHandler.HandleExceptionFunc
member.summary: Gets a delegate function which indicates whether this back-off handler should handle an exception. The default is .

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Http.BackOffHandler.#ctor(Google.Apis.Util.IBackOff)
member.summary: Constructs a new back-off handler with the given back-off.
member.param: The back-off policy.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Http.BackOffHandler.#ctor(Google.Apis.Http.BackOffHandler.Initializer)
member.summary: Constructs a new back-off handler with the given initializer.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Http.BackOffHandler.HandleAsync(System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Handles back-off. In case the request doesn't support retry or the back-off time span is greater than the maximum time span allowed for a request, the handler returns false. Otherwise the current thread will block for x milliseconds (x is defined by the instance), and this handler returns true.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Http.BackOffHandler.Wait(System.TimeSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Waits the given time span. Overriding this method is recommended for mocking purposes.
member.param: TimeSpan to wait (and block the current thread).
The cancellation token in case the user wants to cancel the operation in the middle.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Http.ConfigurableMessageHandler
member.summary: A message handler which contains the main logic of our HTTP requests. It contains a list of s for handling abnormal responses, a list of s for handling exception in a request and a list of s for intercepting a request before it has been sent to the server. It also contains important properties like number of tries, follow redirect, etc.

member.summary: Adds the specified interceptor to the list of execute interceptors.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Http.ConfigurableMessageHandler.InstanceLogger
member.summary: For testing only. This defaults to the static , but can be overridden for fine-grain testing.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Http.ConfigurableMessageHandler.numTries
member.summary: Number of tries. Default is 3.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Http.ConfigurableMessageHandler.NumTries
member.summary:
Gets or sets the number of tries that will be allowed to execute. Retries occur as a result of either or which handles the abnormal HTTP response or exception before being terminated. Set 1 for not retrying requests. The default value is 3.
The number of allowed redirects (3xx) is defined by . This property defines only the allowed tries for >=400 responses, or when an exception is thrown. For example if you set to 1 and to 5, the library will send up to five redirect requests, but will not send any retry requests due to an error HTTP status code.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Http.ConfigurableMessageHandler.numRedirects
member.summary: Number of redirects allowed. Default is 10.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Http.ConfigurableMessageHandler.NumRedirects
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of redirects that will be allowed to execute. The default value is 10. See for more information.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Http.ConfigurableMessageHandler.FollowRedirect
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the handler should follow a redirect when a redirect response is received. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Http.ConfigurableMessageHandler.IsLoggingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether logging is enabled. Default value is true.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Http.ConfigurableMessageHandler.LogEventType
member.summary: Specifies the type(s) of request/response events to log.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Http.ConfigurableMessageHandler.LogEventType.None
member.summary: Log no request/response information.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Http.ConfigurableMessageHandler.LogEventType.RequestUri
member.summary: Log the request URI.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Http.ConfigurableMessageHandler.LogEventType.RequestHeaders
member.summary: Log the request headers.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Http.ConfigurableMessageHandler.LogEventType.RequestBody
member.summary: Log the request body. The body is assumed to be ASCII, and non-printable charaters are replaced by '.'. Warning: This causes the body content to be buffered in memory, so use with care for large requests.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Http.ConfigurableMessageHandler.LogEventType.ResponseStatus
member.summary: Log the response status.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Http.ConfigurableMessageHandler.LogEventType.ResponseHeaders
member.summary: Log the response headers.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Http.ConfigurableMessageHandler.LogEventType.ResponseBody
member.summary: Log the response body. The body is assumed to be ASCII, and non-printable characters are replaced by '.'. Warning: This causes the body content to be buffered in memory, so use with care for large responses.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Http.ConfigurableMessageHandler.LogEventType.ResponseAbnormal
member.summary: Log abnormal response messages.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Http.ConfigurableMessageHandler.LogEvents
member.summary: The request/response types to log.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Http.ConfigurableMessageHandler.ApplicationName
member.summary: Gets or sets the application name which will be used on the User-Agent header.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Http.ConfigurableMessageHandler.#ctor(System.Net.Http.HttpMessageHandler)
member.summary: Constructs a new configurable message handler.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Http.ConfigurableMessageHandler.SendAsync(System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: The main logic of sending a request to the server. This send method adds the User-Agent header to a request with and the library version. It also calls interceptors before each attempt, and unsuccessful response handler or exception handlers when abnormal response or exception occurred.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Http.ConfigurableMessageHandler.HandleRedirect(System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage)
member.summary: Handles redirect if the response's status code is redirect, redirects are turned on, and the header has a location. When the status code is 303 the method on the request is changed to a GET as per the RFC2616 specification. On a redirect, it also removes the Authorization and all If-* request headers.
member.returns: Whether this method changed the request and handled redirect successfully.

member.summary: Handles an exception thrown when sending a HTTP request. A simple rule must be followed, if you modify the request object in a way that the exception can be resolved, you must return true.
member.param: Handle exception argument which properties such as the request, exception, current failed try.
member.returns: Whether this handler has made a change that requires the request to be resent.

member.param: Handle response argument which contains properties such as the request, response, current failed try.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Http.MaxUrlLengthInterceptor
member.summary:
Intercepts HTTP GET requests with a URLs longer than a specified maximum number of characters. The interceptor will change such requests as follows:
The request's method will be changed to POST
A X-HTTP-Method-Override header will be added with the value GET
Any query parameters from the URI will be moved into the body of the request.
If query parameters are moved, the content type is set to application/x-www-form-urlencoded

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Http.MaxUrlLengthInterceptor.#ctor(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Constructs a new Max URL length interceptor with the given max length.

member.summary: Creates a parameter collection from the specified URL encoded query string. Example: The query string "foo=bar&chocolate=cookie" would result in two parameters (foo and bar) with the values "bar" and "cookie" set.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Requests.Parameters.ParameterCollection.FromDictionary(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Creates a parameter collection from the specified dictionary. If the value is an enumerable, a parameter pair will be added for each value. Otherwise the value will be converted into a string using the .ToString() method.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Util.ExponentialBackOff
member.summary: Implementation of that increases the back-off period for each retry attempt using a randomization function that grows exponentially. In addition, it also adds a randomize number of milliseconds for each attempt.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Util.ExponentialBackOff.MaxAllowedNumRetries
member.summary: The maximum allowed number of retries.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Util.ExponentialBackOff.DeltaBackOff
member.summary: Gets the delta time span used to generate a random milliseconds to add to the next back-off. If the value is then the generated back-off will be exactly 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, etc. seconds. A valid value is between zero and one second. The default value is 250ms, which means that the generated back-off will be [0.75-1.25]sec, [1.75-2.25]sec, [3.75-4.25]sec, and so on.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Util.ExponentialBackOff.MaxNumOfRetries
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of retries. Default value is 10.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Util.ExponentialBackOff.random
member.summary: The random instance which generates a random number to add the to next back-off.

member.summary: Constructs a new exponential back-off with default values.

member.summary: Constructs a new exponential back-off with the given delta and maximum retries.

member.summary: Strategy interface to control back-off between retry attempts.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Util.UriPatcher
member.summary: Workarounds for some unfortunate behaviors in the .NET Framework's implementation of System.Uri
member.remarks:
UriPatcher lets us work around some unfortunate behaviors in the .NET Framework's implementation of System.Uri.
== Problem 1: Slashes and dots
Prior to .NET 4.5, System.Uri would always unescape "%2f" ("/") and "%5c" ("\\"). Relative path components were also compressed.
As a result, this: "http://www.example.com/.%2f.%5c./" ... turned into this: "http://www.example.com/"
This breaks API requests where slashes or dots appear in path parameters. Such requests arise, for example, when these characters appear in the name of a GCS object.
== Problem 2: Fewer unreserved characters
Unless IDN/IRI parsing is enabled -- which it is not, by default, prior to .NET 4.5 -- Uri.EscapeDataString uses the set of "unreserved" characters from RFC 2396 instead of the newer, *smaller* list from RFC 3986. We build requests using URI templating as described by RFC 6570, which specifies that the latter definition (RFC 3986) should be used.
This breaks API requests with parameters including any of: !*'()
== Solutions
Though the default behaviors changed in .NET 4.5, these "quirks" remain for compatibility unless the application explicitly targets the new runtime. Usually, that means adding a TargetFrameworkAttribute to the entry assembly.
Applications running on .NET 4.0 or later can also set "DontUnescapePathDotsAndSlashes" and enable IDN/IRI parsing using app.config or web.config.
As a class library, we can't control app.config or the entry assembly, so we can't take either approach. Instead, we resort to reflection trickery to try to solve these problems if we detect they exist. Sorry.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Util.UriPatcher.PatchUriQuirks
member.summary: Patch URI quirks in System.Uri. See class summary for details.
